result.execSummary:
The defendant David Earl Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years and 6 months bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victims A.Y. and D.Y. (person, property, residence or family).  Full compliance with Family Court Orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management and domestic violence counseling. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

supervisions.notes:
***PREVIOUS SENTENCE FROM JUNE 20, 2017 IS VACATED.

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length 
of 5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharges have been paid in this matter.
Obtain and  maintain full time verifiable employment.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  
Defendant is to maintain sobriety.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Defendant must participate in any counseling, programming or treatment deemed appropriate but must include Anger Management counseling.
No contact with named victims.
Firearms warning given.
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Appeal rights given.

Sentencing hearing on October 29, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Denying the motion for a new trial but granting re-sentencing on Cts 1 and 2.
Sentencing hearing on September 24, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David Earl Montgomery in court with attorney Christopher William Rose.  Defendant David Earl Montgomery in custody. Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter: Brady Bish. Matter here on defendant's motion for new trial or sentencing. 

Defense states that the State responded to the Motion but defendant wishes to proceed with motion regardless. Attorney Rose goes through counts and how they relate to the motion they filed. Ct. 1 was not an appropriate enhancer. Ct. 2 there would have had to be a firearm in order for him to be convicted of this specific charge. Recording of officer not provided to jury but exists. 

State stipulates that the Ct. 1 enhancer is not appropriate and was charged out by another attorney. Ct. 2 that there were witnesses that saw defendant brandish firearm. Recording of officer was poor quality. Defendant chose to be pro se so he should be held to the same standard as the State. Would stipulate to re-sentencing hearing due to errors in Ct. 1. 

Defense clarifies that the re-sentencing would be for Ct. 1 & Ct. 2. 

Court colloquy on case. 

BTC: Denying motion for new trial but will order a re-sentencing for Ct. 1 & Ct. 2. Defense requests new judge be assigned for re-sentencing. 

State asks procedural questions regarding how to proceed with dropping the enchancers. Court asks defense to file order reflecting today's hearing.
